intro: Memecylon andamanicum, commonly known as Andaman memecylon, is a flowering plant species native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
